info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 30 at 3:58PM EDT until August 30 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN WASHINGTON COUNTY... At 357 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Whitehall, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement. At 3:40 PM, a downed tree was reported near exit 18 on the New York Thruway from this storm. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Whitehall, Comstock, Huletts Landing, Putnam, Kingsbury, Mount Hope, Wright, Hampton, Fort Ann, South Bay, Chipman Point, Smiths Basin, Putnam Station, North Granville, South Bay Village, Snody Dock, Truthville, Hampton Flats, Grays Corner and West Granville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
